camel.sink.path.path.name: camel.sink.path.path
camel.sink.path.path.description: The path the endpoint refers to

camel.sink.endpoint.servicePath.name: camel.sink.endpoint.servicePath
camel.sink.endpoint.servicePath.description: The path to look for for service discovery

camel.sink.endpoint.timeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.timeout
camel.sink.endpoint.timeout.description: To set the maximum time an action could take to complete.

camel.sink.endpoint.uris.name: camel.sink.endpoint.uris
camel.sink.endpoint.uris.description: To set the URIs the client connects.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.timeToLive.name: camel.sink.endpoint.timeToLive
camel.sink.endpoint.timeToLive.description: To set the lifespan of a key in milliseconds.

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.password.name: camel.sink.endpoint.password
camel.sink.endpoint.password.description: The password to use for basic authentication.

camel.sink.endpoint.userName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.userName
camel.sink.endpoint.userName.description: The user name to use for basic authentication.

camel.component.etcd-stats.servicePath.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.servicePath
camel.component.etcd-stats.servicePath.description: The path to look for for service discovery

camel.component.etcd-stats.timeout.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.timeout
camel.component.etcd-stats.timeout.description: To set the maximum time an action could take to complete.

camel.component.etcd-stats.uris.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.uris
camel.component.etcd-stats.uris.description: To set the URIs the client connects.

camel.component.etcd-stats.lazyStartProd.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.etcd-stats.lazyStartProd.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.etcd-stats.timeToLive.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.timeToLive
camel.component.etcd-stats.timeToLive.description: To set the lifespan of a key in milliseconds.

camel.component.etcd-stats.autowiredEnab.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.etcd-stats.autowiredEnab.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.etcd-stats.password.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.password
camel.component.etcd-stats.password.description: The password to use for basic authentication.

camel.component.etcd-stats.useGlobalSslC.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.etcd-stats.useGlobalSslC.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.

camel.component.etcd-stats.userName.name: camel.component.etcd-stats.userName
camel.component.etcd-stats.userName.description: The user name to use for basic authentication.
